summary: The document is a CIA memorandum dated December 7, 1950, concerning the security clearance process for converting John F. Rittenhouse's status from GPC Staff Employee to UPC Staff Agent. It details his assignment as a GS-13 Intelligence Officer under deep cover and notes the absence of security objections from the office.
key_findings: The document pertains to a personnel status change within the CIA.
It highlights the process of security clearance for converting an employee's status.
The Subject, John F. Rittenhouse, is to be assigned as an Intelligence Officer under deep cover.
No security objections were raised by the office for the proposed conversion and assignment.
